text:
A forward exchange rate quote typically differs from the spot quotation and is expressed
in terms of the difference between the spot exchange rate and the forward exchange rate.
One way to indicate this is with points. The unit of points is the last decimal place in
the spot rate quote. For a spot currency quote to four decimal places, such as 2.3481,
each point is 0.0001 or 1/10,000th. A quote of +18.3 points for a 90-day forward
exchange rate means that the forward rate is 0.00183 more than the spot exchange rate.
